events.title: OpenAI Releases o3 and o4-mini Reasoning Models
events.description: OpenAI released two new reasoning models - o3 and o4-mini - designed to handle broader tasks from coding to visual analysis. The o4-mini is the first o4 model, optimized for cost-efficient reasoning with competitive performance for its size.

events.title: GitHub Copilot Adds o3 and o4-mini Models
events.description: GitHub announced that OpenAI's o3 and o4-mini models are now available in public preview for GitHub Copilot and GitHub Models, enabling developers to experiment with the new reasoning capabilities.

events.title: GPT-4 Retired from ChatGPT
events.description: OpenAI officially retired GPT-4 from ChatGPT, fully replacing it with GPT-4o. The model that sparked global AI race in March 2023 ends its public-facing run, though it remains accessible via API.

events.title: Meta Releases Llama 4 Multimodal Models
events.description: Meta unveiled the Llama 4 family - the first natively multimodal open-source models. Includes Llama 4 Scout (17B parameters, 16 experts) and Llama 4 Maverick, with Llama 4 Behemoth (2 trillion parameters) still in training.

events.title: GitHub Copilot Code Review Goes GA
events.description: GitHub announced general availability of Copilot code review, enabling AI-powered code review that can identify issues, suggest fixes, and improve code quality across pull requests.

events.title: Google Cloud Next 2025: Ironwood TPU and Agent2Agent Protocol
events.description: At Google Cloud Next, Google unveiled Ironwood (7th-gen TPU) - the first TPU designed specifically for inference - and announced the Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A) for AI agent interoperability with 50+ tech partners.

events.title: Gemini 2.5 and Gemma 3 Announced
events.description: Google introduced Gemini 2.5 and Gemma 3 at Cloud Next, along with updates for creativity and collaboration features in the Gemini ecosystem.

events.title: Agent2Agent Protocol Launches with 50+ Partners
events.description: Google Cloud launched the Agent2Agent Protocol (A2A), an open standard enabling AI agents to collaborate across enterprise systems regardless of vendor or framework. Over 50 tech partners joined at launch.

events.title: Anthropic Launches Claude Max at $200/month
events.description: Anthropic introduced Claude Max subscription tier at $100-$200/month, offering 5-20x higher usage limits than the $20 Pro plan. Directly challenges OpenAI's ChatGPT Pro tier.

events.title: Space Llama Deployed to International Space Station
events.description: Booz Allen deployed a fine-tuned version of Meta's Llama 3.2 to the ISS, marking a significant milestone for AI in space. The system runs on HPE's Spaceborne Computer-2 with NVIDIA acceleration.

events.title: OpenAI 4o Image Generation Released
events.description: OpenAI released native image generation capability in GPT-4o, significantly better than DALL-E 3. Features multi-turn consistency, improved text rendering, and ability to modify uploaded images.

events.title: Manus AI Raises $75M at $500M Valuation
events.description: Chinese AI agent startup Manus secured $75 million funding led by Benchmark at $500 million valuation, just weeks after its viral launch claiming to outperform OpenAI's Deep Research.

events.title: Manus AI Goes Viral as 'World's First General AI Agent'
events.description: Chinese startup Manus went viral on X after releasing what it claimed was the world's first general AI agent, capable of autonomous decision-making with minimal prompting.

events.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang at White House 'Investing in America' Event
events.description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang participated in White House event on AI investment, amid ongoing discussions about chip export controls and US-China tech competition.

events.title: Trump Administration Implements New AI Chip Export Controls
events.description: The Trump administration implemented new export controls on AI chips for national security reasons, affecting Nvidia and other semiconductor companies.

events.title: EU AI Office Publishes GPAI Guidelines
events.description: The EU AI Office published preliminary guidelines clarifying obligations for providers of general-purpose AI models under the AI Act, ahead of August 2025 enforcement.

events.title: Google DeepMind Publishes 'Responsible Path to AGI' Paper
events.description: DeepMind researchers published comprehensive paper on responsible AGI development, prioritizing readiness, proactive risk assessment, and collaboration with the AI community.

events.title: OpenAI Introduces 'Monday' Voice in ChatGPT
events.description: OpenAI added a new 'grumpy' voice called Monday to ChatGPT's Voice Mode on April Fools' Day. The voice sounds annoyed and was available through end of April.

events.title: Researchers Claim Breakthrough Against Prompt Injection
events.description: Researchers announced breakthrough in fighting prompt injection attacks, one of AI's most frustrating security vulnerabilities.

events.title: Google DeepMind Introduces CaMel Framework for Prompt Injection Defense
events.description: Google DeepMind introduced the CaMel framework to fundamentally address prompt injection vulnerabilities in AI systems.

events.title: Meta AI Celebrity Chatbots Controversy
events.description: Wall Street Journal reported that Meta AI chatbots using celebrity voices engaged in sexually explicit conversations, including with accounts registered as minors. Meta made changes in response.

events.title: Cursor and Windsurf Release GPT-4.1 to All Users
events.description: AI-powered IDE tools Cursor and Windsurf announced release of GPT-4.1 model to all users, boosting developer productivity.

events.title: OpenAI $40 Billion SoftBank-Led Funding Round Announced
events.description: OpenAI announced $40 billion funding round led by SoftBank, nearly doubling its valuation to $300 billion. SoftBank committed $30 billion with conditions tied to for-profit restructuring.

events.title: OpenAI For-Profit Restructuring Pressure Mounts
events.description: SoftBank's $40B investment came with stipulation that OpenAI must restructure into fully for-profit entity by end of 2025, or contribution would be reduced.

events.title: Agentic AI Era Officially Begins
events.description: Industry observers declared 2025 the 'Agentic Era' as AI agents capable of autonomous task execution became mainstream, with major players releasing agentic coding assistants.

events.title: Top 5 Agentic AI Coding Assistants Emerge
events.description: Industry analysis identified top agentic AI coding assistants that can plan solutions, modify multiple files, run tests, and iterate on code autonomously.

events.title: AI Coding Tools Enter 'Agentic CLI Era'
events.description: The emergence of command-line AI coding tools marked a new phase in developer tooling, with agents operating directly in terminal environments.

events.title: Stanford HAI Releases 2025 AI Index Report
events.description: Stanford's Human-Centered AI Institute released its 2025 AI Index Report, providing comprehensive data-driven analysis of AI's global development.

events.title: AI Investment Hits Record Levels
events.description: AI companies on track for record $150 billion in 2025 funding, with 79% going to US-based companies and San Francisco Bay Area alone raising $122 billion.

events.title: DeepSeek Continues to Gain Traction in Developing Nations
events.description: Microsoft report showed Chinese AI company DeepSeek gaining significant traction in developing nations following its January 2025 R1 model release.

events.title: AI Copyright Lawsuits Intensify
events.description: Major developments in AI copyright cases including Bartz v. Anthropic and Kadrey v. Meta, with courts beginning to define fair use boundaries for AI training.

events.title: OWASP Lists Prompt Injection as #1 LLM Risk
events.description: OWASP recognized prompt injection as the #1 risk in its 2025 Top 10 for LLM Applications, highlighting growing security concerns.

events.title: AI Safety Index Released
events.description: Future of Life Institute released AI Safety Index tracking safety measures across major AI labs and models.

events.title: Anthropic Publishes AI Safety Research Directions
events.description: Anthropic published recommendations for technical AI safety research directions to help developers ensure safety of future systems.

events.title: Microsoft Copilot Studio 2025 Wave 1 Begins
events.description: Microsoft's 2025 release wave 1 for Copilot Studio began, covering new functionalities planned through September 2025.

events.title: Perplexity AI Continues Rapid Growth
events.description: AI search startup Perplexity continued rapid growth trajectory, challenging Google's search dominance with AI-powered answer engine.

events.title: AI Humanoid Robots Development Accelerates
events.description: Major developments in humanoid robotics with Tesla Optimus, Figure, and Agility Digit scaling pilots with major companies.

events.title: Nvidia Faces Export Control Challenges
events.description: Nvidia grappled with new export controls on AI chips while maintaining strong demand for its products.

events.title: AI in Healthcare Advances
events.description: Continued advances in AI healthcare applications with new tools for evidence-based medicine and clinical decision support.

events.title: China's AI Chip Development Accelerates
events.description: Reports emerged of China's 'Manhattan Project' to develop domestic AI chips, including reverse-engineered EUV lithography machines.

events.title: Mistral AI Continues European AI Leadership
events.description: French AI lab Mistral maintained position as Europe's leading homegrown AI player, though facing increased competition from US rivals.

events.title: Apple's AI Strategy Under Scrutiny
events.description: Apple's cautious AI approach continued to draw attention as competitors advanced, with expectations for improved Siri in 2026.

events.title: AI Video Generation Matures
events.description: AI video generation tools like OpenAI's Sora and Google's Veo continued to mature, raising concerns about visual content authenticity.

events.title: xAI and Grok Development Continues
events.description: Elon Musk's xAI continued development of Grok chatbot, integrated into X platform with various new features.

events.title: AI Bubble Concerns Grow
events.description: Growing concerns about AI investment bubble as funding reached unprecedented levels, with questions about sustainable returns.

events.title: Enterprise AI Adoption Accelerates
events.description: Enterprise AI adoption continued rapid acceleration with ChatGPT Enterprise messages increasing 8x year-over-year.

events.title: AI Engineering Emerges as Distinct Discipline
events.description: AI Engineering solidified as distinct discipline with focus on agents, MCP protocol, and production-grade AI systems.

events.title: Vibe Coding Trend Emerges
events.description: Term 'vibe coding' coined by Andrej Karpathy gained traction, describing new approach to AI-assisted development.

events.title: Open Source AI Models Gain Ground
events.description: Open source AI models continued gaining ground with Meta's Llama 4 and Chinese models like Qwen powering startup ecosystem.

events.title: AI Developer Tools Market Heats Up
events.description: Competition in AI developer tools intensified with Cursor, Windsurf, GitHub Copilot, and new entrants vying for developer mindshare.

thematic_clusters.name: Frontier Model Releases
thematic_clusters.description: Major AI model releases from leading labs including OpenAI, Meta, Google, and Anthropic

thematic_clusters.name: Agentic AI and Developer Tools
thematic_clusters.description: Rise of AI agents and transformation of software development workflows

thematic_clusters.description: Hardware developments, TPUs, and semiconductor competition

thematic_clusters.name: Global AI Competition
